definitions.text: the rising of a body of water and its overflowing onto normally dry land
light that is a source of artificial illumination having a broad beam; used in photography
the act of flooding; filling to overflowing
the occurrence of incoming water (between a low tide and the following high tide);  -Shakespeare
examples: a tide in the affairs of men which, taken at the flood, leads on to fortune

definitions.text: fill quickly beyond capacity; as with a liquid
examples: the basement was inundated after the storm
The swollen river flooded the village
The broken vein had flooded blood in her eyes
flood the market with tennis shoes
Glut the country with cheap imports from the Orient
Our basement flooded during the heavy rains
